page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: The land around Pittington and Littletown sustains a variety of farming. Eight farms were studied by the children, and they learnt that farming is considered more of a "way of life" than a "job of work". { Hallgarth Farm}is approximately 230 acres. The Hodgson family keep pigs and a beef herd. This year 100 acres was used for cereals and 20 acres for peas, with 90 acres of grass for hay. The Middlemass family at{Littletown {Farm}farm 66.5 hectares. They grow wheat (9.2 hectares), winter barley (14.1h), spring barley (9.7h), oats (2.9h), & potatoes (3.8h). Their beef herd consists of Limosin and Charolais crosses. {Glenmoor Farm }and {Town Farm}are now one farm of 200 acres. They have a fine Friesian dairy herd & 3,000 hens. Cereals,potatoes & turnips are grown.
